sentences.en: Eventually, you'll exhaust all conventional vibrato approaches, all the ways you saw someone else do it.
sentences.cn: 最后, 你将用尽所有常规的颤音动效果, 所有你曾看见其他的人做过的方式.

sentences.en: How do you produce this kind of tone and vibrato?
sentences.cn: 你是怎样发出这种音调和振音的?

sentences.en: I encourage oboe and clarinet players to use plenty of vibrato.
sentences.cn: 我鼓励演奏双簧管和单簧管的乐手们多使用颤音。

sentences.en: I picked up my cello, screw tight the hairs of the bow and soar once more into Belle Nuit, the vibrato still wobbling like an unbalanced tire.
sentences.cn: 我拿起我的大提琴，拧紧弓毛，再一次悠扬地奏起《夜色美丽》，颤音仍然颤抖如同不平衡的轮胎。

sentences.en: So at first glance, the idea of a seasonal flamenco Christmas performance seems as wobbly as a cantaora's vibrato.
sentences.cn: 所以初看上去，弗拉门戈舞作为圣诞季节的表演与女歌星Cantaora 的颤音一样令人心颤而略带伤感。

sentences.en: The objective of vibrato in playing violin is to serve the artistic expression of music.
sentences.cn: 小提琴演奏中的揉弦的出发点和目的是为音乐的艺术表现服务的.

sentences.en: When not playing vibrato, use the palm of your right hand to work the key.
sentences.cn: (当不演奏(手)振音时, 用你的右手手掌操作钥匙(推杆). )

trans.tran_en: a way of singing or playing a musical note so that it goes up and down very slightly in pitch
